data.title: NBA Trivia Quiz: Nothin' but Net
data.meta_description: Put your NBA knowledge to the test! Take the ultimate trivia quiz and celebrate the league's iconic moments.
data.text:
Image: Focus on Sport/Getty Images/Andrew Brusso/Neal Preston/Â© Corbis

In what city were the Los Angeles Lakers initially based?

Detroit, Michigan

Minneapolis, Minnesota

Rochester, New York

Correct Answer

Wrong Answer

Before moving to Los Angeles in 1960, the Lakers were based in Minneapolis.

Wilt Chamberlain once scored 100 points in a game. Which player has the second-highest total points in a single game?

Kobe Bryant

LeBron James

Kareem Abdul-Jabbar

Correct Answer

Wrong Answer

Lakers guard Kobe Bryant scored 81 points against the Toronto Raptors in 2006.

Who guarded Michael Jordan when he made his buzzer-beater against Cleveland in the 1989 playoffs?

Bryon Russell

Charles Barkley

Craig Ehlo

Correct Answer

Wrong Answer

Craig Ehlo was guarding Jordan when he made "the shot," as basketball fans call it.

Advertisement

Advertisement

How long is a regulation NBA game?

40 minutes

48 minutes

60 minutes

Correct Answer

Wrong Answer

The NBA has tested out shorter times, like a 44-minute game.

Has a player ever averaged a triple-double for an entire season?

yes

no

Correct Answer

Wrong Answer

Oscar Robertson of the Cincinnati Royals averaged a triple-double in the 1961-62 season.

How many seconds does an NBA team get to shoot?

10 seconds

24 seconds

30 seconds

Correct Answer

Wrong Answer

The NBA's 24-second shot clock debuted in 1954.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Which of these players has a father who also played in the NBA?

Steph Curry

LeBron James

Kristaps Porzingis

Correct Answer

Wrong Answer

Steph Curry's father, Dell Curry, also played in the NBA.

Who was the first Mexican-born player in the NBA?

Eduardo Najera

Carlos Delfino

Horacio Llamas

Correct Answer

Wrong Answer

In 1997, Phoenix Suns center Horacio Llamas became the first Mexican-born player in the NBA.

Which NBA team has won the most titles?

Los Angeles Lakers

Chicago Bulls

Boston Celtics

Correct Answer

Wrong Answer

The Boston Celtics have won 17 NBA titles, the most of any team.

Advertisement

Advertisement

What former player was the inspiration for the NBA logo?

Wilt Chamberlain

Jerry West

Elgin Baylor

Correct Answer

Wrong Answer

Alan Siegel, who designed the logo in 1969, says it's based on a photograph of Jerry West.

Which of these players went straight to the NBA from high school?

John Wall

Monta Ellis

Kevin Durant

Correct Answer

Wrong Answer

Monta Ellis was drafted by the Golden State Warriors as soon as he graduated from high school in 2005.

What were the New Orleans Pelicans previously called?

Hornets

Bullets

Royals

Correct Answer

Wrong Answer

The New Orleans Pelicans, formerly known as the Hornets, changed their name in 2013.

Advertisement

Advertisement

In what season did the NBA adopt the 3-point shot?

1969-70

1979-80

1991-92

Correct Answer

Wrong Answer

The NBA started using the 3-point shot in the 1979-80 season.

In the last two minutes, where can a team inbound after a timeout?

frontcourt

backcourt only

under the opponent's basket

Correct Answer

Wrong Answer

In an inbounds play in the last two minutes, the offensive team can move the ball to midcourt or take it at the spot.

What was the late NBA player Darryl Dawkins’ nickname?

Clyde

All-World

Chocolate Thunder

Correct Answer

Wrong Answer

Backboard-shattering dunker Darryl Dawkins was known as Chocolate Thunder.

Advertisement

Advertisement

What former NBA player became famous for marketing a brand of $15 sneakers?

Stephon Marbury

Charles Barkley

Michael Jordan

Correct Answer

Wrong Answer

Former NBA player Stephon Marbury endorsed Starbury, a signature line of inexpensive sneakers.

How long does an NBA team have to get the ball across the midcourt line?

eight seconds

24 seconds

30 seconds

Correct Answer

Wrong Answer

An NBA team must get the ball across midcourt in eight seconds or less.

Who can overturn referee calls based on video replays during a game?

league officials

fans

head referee

Correct Answer

Wrong Answer

League officials in Secaucus, New Jersey can overturn some calls after reviewing the instant-replay video.

Advertisement

Advertisement

What percentage of corner 3-pointers do NBA teams make, on average?

25 percent

30 percent

40 percent

Correct Answer

Wrong Answer

NBA teams make almost 40 percent of their corner 3-pointers, one of the best risk-reward shots.

How long can a defensive player stay in the key area if he is not guarding an opponent?

one second

three seconds

10 seconds

Correct Answer

Wrong Answer

The three-second count starts when it is evident the offensive team controls frontcourt.

Who is the youngest player to score 25,000 points in his career?

LeBron James

Michael Jordan

Wilt Chamberlain

Correct Answer

Wrong Answer

LeBron James recently became the youngest player, at 30, to score 25,000 points.

Advertisement

Advertisement

What manufacturer makes the official NBA game ball?

Wilson

Nike

Spalding

Correct Answer

Wrong Answer

Spalding has been the official game ball of the NBA since 1983.

What is the average height of an NBA player?

6 feet, 3 inches (2 meters)

6 feet, 7 inches

6 feet, 11 inches

Correct Answer

Wrong Answer

The average NBA player is more than 9 inches (23 centimeters) taller than the average American man.

Who won the highest-scoring NBA game ever?

Detroit Pistons

Los Angeles Clippers

Dallas Mavericks

Correct Answer

Wrong Answer

The Detroit Pistons beat the Denver Nuggets 186 to 184 in 1983.

Advertisement

Advertisement

How long is an NBA overtime period?

two minutes

five minutes

24 minutes

Correct Answer

Wrong Answer

The NBA allows 130 seconds before any five-minute overtime period.

What player has the record for most offensive rebounds in a game?

Zaza Pachulia

Moses Malone

Kevin Garnett

Correct Answer

Wrong Answer

Milwaukee's Zaza Pachulia set a record in a 2015 game with 18 offensive rebounds.

Who was the first foreign-born NBA player to become league MVP?

Toni Kukoc

Dirk Nowitzki

Pau Gasol

Correct Answer

Wrong Answer

Dirk Nowitzki of the Dallas Mavericks was the first foreign-born player to become MVP in 2007.

Advertisement

Advertisement

At the buzzer, a shot is good if it already has done what?

gone through the net

left the shooter's hand

appeared on the scoreboard

Correct Answer

Wrong Answer

Instant replay can be used to verify whether a buzzer beater left the shooter's hand before the game clock expired.

Advertisement

Advertisement

You Got:

/30

Focus on Sport/Getty Images/Andrew Brusso/Neal Preston/Â© Corbis
